title: Danielle Lloyd on her reaction to Coleen Rooney Rebekah Vardy drama
text:
Danielle Lloyd has explained why she weighed in on Coleen Rooney and Rebekah Vardy drama (Picture: Ken McKay/ITV/REX)

Danielle Lloyd says she chimed in on the Coleen Rooney and Rebekah Vardy scandal as similar things have happened to her.

After Coleen shared a statement accusing Rebekah’s social media account of selling stories to the press, Danielle commented with three rat emojis and we all lost our minds.

Speaking to Mirror Online, the former glamour model said: ‘Obviously everybody is entitled to their opinion at the end of the day and I had my opinion, and obviously she didn’t like it but I feel like it was just the craziest thing that happened.

‘I didn’t even say anything at the beginning I just put emojis and it just blew up. At the end of the day it’s just one of those things and it’ll be old news next week. There’ll be someone else.’

Coleen revealed earlier this month how she put on her detective hat and planted false stories on her private Instagram account.

She blocked every account but Becky’s from viewing her stories to test whether or not the information would leak.

Coleen’s statement in full (Picture: coleen_rooney/Instagram)

And when they did, she told the world what had happened in a bombshell statement that went viral.

Rebekah – who is married to footballer Jamie Vardy – denied leaking stories and was ‘disgusted’ about having to deny Coleen’s claims, especially when she’s heavily pregnant.

Coleen should become a private investigator (Picture: Max Mumby/Indigo/Getty Images)

The WAG claimed to have hired a forensic IT expert to prove her innocence and is considering legal action.

Danielle said: ‘Maybe we might find out exactly what happened – who knows?

‘I’ve had my own family members sell stories on me and it just divides the family and I would never speak to that person again.

Rebekah Vardy replied with a statement of her own (Picture: Twitter/RebekahVardy)

‘It’s not nice, I’ve had it done to me and they full on knew what they were doing and they were like, “Yeah it’s me, I’m selling the story”.

‘So for people to be selling stories on you and you don’t know who they are, it’s not nice not knowing who you can trust.’

The moral of the story is to trust nobody when you’re a WAG, no exceptions.
